This module contains support to manipulate process.

Procs

proc `$`(x: Process): string {...}{.borrow.}
The stringify operator for a process. 
proc `==`(x, y: Process): bool {...}{.borrow.}
Checks for equality between two process. 
proc repr(x: Process): string {...}{.raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect].}
Returns string representation of a process. 
proc getHandle(process: Process): DWORD {...}{.inline, raises: [], tags: [].}
Gets the Win32 process ID (PID) from the specified process. 
proc isExists(process: Process): bool {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Checks to see if a specified process exists. 
proc isProcessExists(name: string): bool {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Checks to see if a specified process exists. 
proc kill(process: Process): bool {...}{.discardable, raises: [], tags: [].}
Terminates a process. 
proc killProcess(name: string) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Terminates all processes with the same name. 
proc waitProcess(name: string; timeout = 0): Process {...}{.discardable, raises: [], tags: [].}
Pauses until a given process exists. timeout specifies how long to wait (in seconds). Default (0) is to wait indefinitely. Returns the process or InvalidProcess if timeout. 
proc waitClose(process: Process; timeout = 0): DWORD {...}{.discardable, raises: [], tags: [].}
Pauses until a given process does not exist. timeout specifies how long to wait (in seconds). Default (0) is to wait indefinitely. Returns exit code of the process or STILL_ACTIVE(259) if timeout. 
proc setPriority(process: Process; priority: ProcessPriority): bool {...}{.discardable,
    raises: [], tags: [].}
Changes the priority of a process. 
proc getPriority(process: Process): ProcessPriority {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Gets the priority of a process. 
proc getPath(process: Process): string {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Gets the path of a process. 
proc getName(process: Process): string {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Gets the name of a process.

Iterators

iterator processes(): tuple[name: string, process: Process] {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Iterates over all processes. 
iterator processes(name: string): Process {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Iterates over process of specified name.

Examples:

proc example() =
  for process in processes("notepad.exe"):
    waitClose(process)

iterator windows(process: Process): Window {...}{.raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect].}
Iterates over all top-level windows that created by the specified process. 
iterator allWindows(process: Process): Window {...}{.raises: [Exception],
    tags: [RootEffect].}
Iterates over all windows that created by the specified process.

Made with Nim.
